import json
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.dates as mdates
import datetime

# Load JSON data
with open('output.json') as f:
    data = json.load(f)

# Extract timestamps and temperatures
timestamps = [obj['_id'] for obj in data]
temperatures = [obj['avgTemp'] for obj in data]

# Convert timestamps to datetime objects
datetime_timestamps = [datetime.datetime.strptime(timestamp, '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ') for timestamp in timestamps]

# Create the plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(datetime_timestamps, temperatures, marker='o')

# Set title and labels
plt.title('Average Temperature Over Time')
plt.xlabel('Time')
plt.ylabel('Average Temperature (°C)')

# Format x-axis to display dates
plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_formatter(mdates.DateFormatter('%H:%M'))
plt.gcf().autofmt_xdate()

# Save the plot to a file
plt.savefig('result.png', bbox_inches='tight')

# Close the plot to free up system resources
plt.close()
